alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 9:28PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels Continue on Interior Rivers... Cooler temperatures are expected through midweek as cold air is pulled south. Low temperatures will fall to around freezing in most areas with highs only reaching into the 40s. These cooler temperatures will slow the ongoing snowmelt process, but rivers will remain high across the area. Breakup continues along the Yukon River, and there remains the potential for ice jams as the breakup front moves downstream. For the latest river information, go to www.weather.gov/aprfc. For the latest weather forecasts, go to www.weather.gov/afg.
